metadata.criteria: Complete measurements with location + harvest timing + Brix value
sources_searched: Texas A&M AgriLife Extension / Citrus Center
metadata.note: Limited complete datasets found meeting all three criteria (location + timing + Brix). Most sources provided partial information or general ranges.

complete_measurements.location: Rio Queen Citrus, Rio Grande Valley
complete_measurements.source: PMC Study - Influence of storage temperature on Rio Red grapefruit
complete_measurements.notes: Initial harvest measurement, week 0 of storage study. Storage up to 12 weeks maintained Brix 11.20-11.97 range.

partial_measurements.notes: Rio Star measures 9-11째 Brix. Commercial marketing data, not research trial. Rio Star is trademarked name for Texas Rio Red.

partial_measurements.harvest_season: Fall to winter as fruit matures, October-January
partial_measurements.source: Fertilization Programs for Rio Red Grapefruit in South Texas
partial_measurements.notes: Brix:acid ratio averaged 2.4, increases October to January. Juice sampled 2-4 times/year during fall maturation. Study by Texas A&M.

partial_measurements.harvest_season: Harvests: April 16 (before flowering), May 6 (full bloom), May 28 (after flowering), June 18 (6 weeks post-bloom)
partial_measurements.source: Harvest time and storage conditions study
partial_measurements.notes: 35-year-old trees, TSS 10.6째Brix. Multiple harvest dates for summer consumption study. Location not specified in search results.
12-14째 Brix, balanced flavor. Commercial data, not research trial.

partial_measurements.harvest_season: Florida: November-May, Texas: October-May, Peak: November-March
partial_measurements.notes: Red varieties have higher Brix than pink or white grapefruit. General range, not specific trial data.
Duncan showed maximum TSS at 9.56%, comparable to Marsh SL at 9.53%. Location and harvest timing not specified.
Marsh SL had 9.53% TSS (Brix), 40.13% juice content, 1.56% acidity. Location and harvest timing not specified.

partial_measurements.location: Indian River area, west of Vero Beach
partial_measurements.source: UF/IFAS Indian River Marsh grapefruit rootstock trial
partial_measurements.notes: Rootstock trial planted 2007. Trees on 5 rootstocks produced 3000-4000 kg/ha soluble solids at 7 years. Overall Brix values described as 'low'.
Oroblanco had highest TSS at 9.65째Brix among cultivars tested. CA requires 10:1 Brix:acid ratio minimum. Pummelo x grapefruit hybrid.
Released 1986, from same 1958 cross as Oroblanco. Much lower acidity than regular grapefruit. Specific Brix not found.

partial_measurements.source: ASHS HortScience - Rootstock Effects on Ray Ruby study
partial_measurements.notes: Compared 7 rootstocks in commercial orchard. Rootstock affected total solids and solids:acid ratio significantly. Specific Brix values in publication (access blocked).
Available only in February in Indian River region. Henderson seedling from Florida, released 1983.
Experimental selection described as 'dark red, high brix' reaching 12 Brix in October. Breeding trial data.
Experimental selection described as 'dark red, high brix, blush'. Specific Brix value not found.

general_standards.standard: USDA minimum maturity for fresh grapefruit
general_standards.notes: Minimum 7.5% TSS (Brix) required for imported fresh grapefruit maturity
Texas follows USDA standards for grapefruit maturity
Total soluble solids (Brix) increase in grapefruit from October to February as fruit matures. Lower leaf nitrogen during maturation favors higher Brix.
Red varieties generally have higher Brix than pink grapefruit, which have higher Brix than white grapefruit.

issues_encountered: Many university research publications behind paywalls (ResearchGate 403 errors, journal access blocked)
Most commercial sources provide Brix ranges without specific harvest dates
Location data often vague (e.g., 'Texas' or 'Florida' without county/city)
Harvest timing often seasonal rather than dated
Many studies measure Brix:acid ratio but not individual Brix values
PDFs from university sources not extractable via WebFetch
repositories_blocked: Many UF/IFAS and Texas A&M PDFs (unreadable binary)
search_limitations.recommendation: Direct contact with Texas A&M Citrus Center (Weslaco), UF/IFAS CREC (Lake Alfred), and UC Riverside Citrus Variety Collection for access to complete trial data with all three required parameters.
